message.content:
cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SC. 

The paper deals with lower bounds on the approximate degree of Boolean functions, which is a central topic in computational complexity theory (cs.CC). The use of linear programming and dual solutions is a common technique in information theory (cs.IT) and optimization (cs.DS). The paper also involves the construction of explicit polynomials, which is a topic in algebraic geometry and representation theory (cs.SC). Finally, the paper re-proves several Markov-type inequalities, which are important in approximation theory and have applications throughout theoretical computer science (cs.LG).
